{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks about the person who discovered the structure and amino acid sequence of insulin, as well as the interspecies differences in molecular structure, and won the Nobel prize for it. From the relevant documents, it is mentioned that Frederick Sanger determined the amino acid structure of insulin in 1951 and was awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1958 for his work on the structure of proteins, especially that of insulin. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Frederick Sanger.", "answer_choice": "B"}
